comment.author: 8879749@N06
comment._content: A photo with similar subject matter is at website www.shorpy.com/node/2248 It is described as "Posters advertising a 1936 circus near Lynchburg, South Carolina. 35mm nitrate negative by Walker Evans for the Farm Security Administration."

comment.author: 37039158@N04
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Kcity, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Saul Zackson: You have a sharp eye! The photograph on Shorpy is also from the Library of Congress Farm Security Administration, and is found in the Prints and Photographs Online Catalog here. Other photographs from the same series are available as well: one, two and three. Enjoy!

comment.author: 49696087@N00
comment._content: The Downie Family Circus belonged to my great grandparents! This is wonderful to find - thank you!

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: sfgirlbybay: How wonderful that you were able to track down this family connection! As I linked above, we have a few other images of this building covered with advertising for the Downie Bros. Circus. Here are those links again: one, two and three. I hope you enjoy them!
